Package it.polimi.ingsw.network

Class Server

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.network.Server
public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
Class that handles all aspects related to network server-side. Project is mainly based over distributed systems that are linked through socket and TCP protocol. It waits for client to connect and handles multiple matches. It has also enables client reconnection based on its identification through chosen nickname.

  • Constructor Details

    • Server

      public Server​(int PORT) throws java.io.IOException
      Initializes a server reachable from remote hosts.
      Parameters:
      PORT - endpoint over which the server is listening for connections.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

  • Method Details

    • reply

      public void reply​(java.lang.Runnable pingSend)
      Method used to send pong messages back to clients.
      Parameters:
      pingSend - function that sends pong message.

    • start

      public void start()
      Method that runs infinitely until the server is shutdown. It accepts inbound connections, sets a timeout for them and creates a new thread that will handle each one of them.

    • addWaitingPlayer

      public void addWaitingPlayer​(ClientStatus awaitingConnection)
      Adds a remote host to the set of client that are waiting for a game to start.
      Parameters:
      awaitingConnection - client that waits for a game to start after nickname choice step.

    • lobby

      public void lobby​(ClientStatus clientStatus)
      The method handles decisions about wait or start a match, based on the number of players that are waiting. This works as follows: basically the first guest selects number of players for a multiplayer mode and then waits until number is reached, looking for clients that wants to play same kind of game. When required number is reached, the match starts and Client Status are removed from those who are waiting. Server supports multiple matches, so this process is repeated each time a client connects.
      Parameters:
      clientStatus - represents remote host that has just connected and selected a multiplayer mode.

    • isPlayerWithSameNicknamePlaying

      public boolean isPlayerWithSameNicknamePlaying​(java.lang.String nickname)
      Boolean method to detect if a player is already playing a game when it tries to reconnect.
      Parameters:
      nickname - nickname chosen by remote host.

    • inactivePlayerAlreadyRegistered

      public boolean inactivePlayerAlreadyRegistered​(java.lang.String nickname)
      Boolean method to detect if a player was playing a game and has disconnected from it.
      Parameters:
      nickname - nickname chosen by remote host.

    • getNumOfMissingPlayers

      public int getNumOfMissingPlayers​(int numOfPlayersChosen)
      Returns the number of players that are needed to start a game.
      Parameters:
      numOfPlayersChosen - number of players that will play a game.

    • getAwaitingGuests

      private java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAwaitingGuests​(int numOfPlayersChosen)
      Returns a list of nickname that are waiting for a game to start.
      Parameters:
      numOfPlayersChosen - number of players required to start a game.

    • notifyLobbyJoin

      public void notifyLobbyJoin​(int numOfPlayersChosen, java.lang.String guest)
      According to number of players chosen, it notifies remote hosts that a guest has just joined the lobby. In this way clients are able to know how many players miss to start the game.

    • getSuitableConnections

      private java.util.Set<ClientStatus> getSuitableConnections​(int numOfPlayers)
      Returns a set of ClientStatus that have chosen the same number of players for a game.

    • getClientAsPlayer

      private Player getClientAsPlayer​(ClientStatus client)

    • initializeGame

      public void initializeGame​(java.util.Set<ClientStatus> clients)
      Initializes a multiplayer mode game and its controller.
      Parameters:
      clients - remote hosts involved in new game.

    • initializeGame

      public void initializeGame​(ClientStatus client)
      Initializes a solo mode game.
      Parameters:
      client - remote host that plays in solo mode.

    • resumeGame

      public void resumeGame​(ClientStatus reconnectingClient)
      This method allows player reconnection. It basically creates a new NetworkRemoteView to a game instance already created and binds it with the client that is reconnecting.
      Parameters:
      reconnectingClient - remote host that wants to join after a disconnection.

    • removeNotSetupPlayer

      public void removeNotSetupPlayer​(ClientStatus clientNotSetup)
      It removes a remote host if it disconnects without completing configuration. Nickname chosen is deleted and the ClientStatus won't be available for any game.
      Parameters:
      clientNotSetup - client that lost or closed the connection.

    • registerClientStatus

      public void registerClientStatus​(java.lang.String nickname, ClientStatus clientStatus)
      Adds a ClientStatus and its nickname to registered accounts.
      Parameters:
      nickname - unique nickname chosen by remote host.

    • deleteMatch

      public void deleteMatch​(java.util.List<User> usersInAPausedMessage)
      It deletes a game after all players have disconnected.
      Parameters:
      usersInAPausedMessage - users involved a paused match.
